segments.pli: “Pañcime, bhikkhave, vassassa antarāyā, yaṃ nemittā na jānanti, yattha nemittānaṃ cakkhu na kamati.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these five obstacles to rain, which the forecasters don’t know, and which their vision does not traverse.
In the upper atmosphere the fire element flares up,

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamo vassassa antarāyo, yaṃ nemittā na jānanti, yattha nemittānaṃ cakkhu na kamati.
segments.en: This is the first obstacle to rain, which the forecasters don’t know, and which their vision does not traverse.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, upari ākāse vāyodhātu pakuppati.
segments.en: Furthermore, in the upper atmosphere the air element flares up,

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyo vassassa antarāyo, yaṃ nemittā na jānanti, yattha nemittānaṃ cakkhu na kamati.
segments.en: This is the second obstacle to rain …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, rāhu asurindo pāṇinā udakaṃ sampaṭicchitvā mahāsamudde chaḍḍeti.
segments.en: Furthermore, Rāhu, lord of demons, receives water in his hand and tosses it in the ocean.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyo vassassa antarāyo, yaṃ nemittā na jānanti, yattha nemittānaṃ cakkhu na kamati.
segments.en: This is the third obstacle to rain …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, vassavalāhakā devā pamattā honti.
segments.en: Furthermore, the gods of the rain clouds become negligent.

segments.pli: Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, catuttho vassassa antarāyo, yaṃ nemittā na jānanti, yattha nemittānaṃ cakkhu na kamati.
segments.en: This is the fourth obstacle to rain …

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, manussā adhammikā honti.
Ayaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamo vassassa antarāyo, yaṃ nemittā na jānanti, yattha nemittānaṃ cakkhu na kamati.
segments.en: This is the fifth obstacle to rain, which the forecasters don’t know, and which their vision does not traverse.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca vassassa antarāyā, yaṃ nemittā na jānanti, yattha nemittānaṃ cakkhu na kamatī”ti.
segments.en: These are the five obstacles to rain, which the forecasters don’t know, and which their vision does not traverse.”
